content.question: If <math alttext="the derivative of y with respect to x equals, 16 times the sine cubed of x, times cosine x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>16</mn><msup><mrow><mi>sin</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mi>x</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.15em"></mspace><mo>⁢</mo><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></math> and <math alttext="y equals 16 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>16</mn></mrow></math> when <math alttext="x equals pi over 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>, what is the value of <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> when <math alttext="x equals pi over 6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math> ?

topic.text: 7.7: Finding Particular Solutions Using Initial Conditions and Separation of Variables

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
